channel.title: Canging chat color? ***NOT NOOB***
channel.description: I saw the TUT a few day's ago and now I cant find it anyone know how to do it? :| (Change chat color)

item.title: Canging chat color? ***NOT NOOB***
item.dc:creator: @Zanzibar Zanzibar
item.description:
@Zanzibar wrote:

[quote=“MoparRocksScape, post:4, topic:108167”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=154807.msg1456829#msg1456829 date=1181422958]
Search for chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS(); and if you want the text to be white change it to this chatTextColor = @whi@I guess, I’m not sure though but try.
[/quote]
No, do not do that. There is a number for each color. Anyways DO NOT CHANGE THE COLOR. Leave it to default. If you change the color, text will be messed up. If you say “Hi my name is…” it may just come out to “i my me is.”[/quote]
That Only Happens With Moparscape Client Thought…

Read full topic

item.title: Canging chat color? ***NOT NOOB***
item.dc:creator: @0_W_N_3_R 0 W N 3 R
item.description:
@0_W_N_3_R wrote:

Theres this code

: // regular chat chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS(); chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS(); chatTextSize = (byte)(packetSize-2);

Where do i put the @whi@ for example?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 09, 2007, 10:07:37 AM[/size][hr][quote=“MoparRocksScape, post:4, topic:108167”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=154807.msg1456829#msg1456829 date=1181422958]
Search for chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS(); and if you want the text to be white change it to this chatTextColor = @whi@I guess, I’m not sure though but try.
[/quote]
No, do not do that. There is a number for each color. Anyways DO NOT CHANGE THE COLOR. Leave it to default. If you change the color, text will be messed up. If you say “Hi my name is…” it may just come out to “i my me is.”[/quote]

All right mike I wont

Read full topic

item.title: Canging chat color? ***NOT NOOB***
item.dc:creator: @MoparRocksScape MoparRocksScape
item.description:
@MoparRocksScape wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Search for chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS(); and if you want the text to be white change it to this chatTextColor = @whi@I guess, I’m not sure though but try.

No, do not do that. There is a number for each color. Anyways DO NOT CHANGE THE COLOR. Leave it to default. If you change the color, text will be messed up. If you say “Hi my name is…” it may just come out to “i my me is.”

Read full topic
